main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in the vicinity of San Antonio, Texas, in July and November of 1952, as documented in the Project Blue Book reports.
interesting points: The reported UFOs were described as bright white lights, cigar-shaped, and circular in shape, with some exhibiting a pulsating red glow around the perimeter.
Witnesses included experienced control tower operators, pilots, and crew members of military aircraft, lending credibility to the sightings.
The UFOs were observed to climb and ascend rapidly, disappear behind clouds, and move at extremely high rates of speed, exceeding the capabilities of known aircraft at the time.

Radar control and aircraft attempted to intercept the unidentified objects but were unable to overtake them. Although radar contact was made in some instances, no physical evidence or photographs were obtained.

Despite detailed eyewitness accounts, no definitive explanation or classification was provided for these sightings, leading to the incidents being labeled as 'Unidentified' in the Project Blue Book records.
sighted object: bright white lights, cigar-shaped, circular objects
witnesses: experienced control tower operators, pilots, crew members of military aircraft
